bibl.author: Nāgārjunagarbha
lo ts+tsha ba sur+ya ki rti
Kanakavarman

notesStmt.note: Last updated at 07/09/2018 at 10:25:28 by admin

Dudjom and Kapstein (The Nyingma School of Tibetan Buddhism, vol. 1, p. 479) note that the balimācārya [master of offerings] at Vikramaśīla was named Nāgārjunagarbha but is never called "ārya" ('phags pa). However, sometimes ārya Nāgārjuna is referred to as ārya Nāgārjunagarbha, and so references by that name should not be confused with the master of offerings at Vikramaśīla. There is a similar question of authorship with regard to the Caturmudrānvaya (Toh. 2225) attributed to a Nāgārjunagarbhapādā (klu sgrub snying po zhal snga nas) that is subsequently quoted by Advayavajra in the Pañcatathāgatamudrāvivaraṇa (Toh. 2242).
